alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 4:01PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Whiteside, northeastern Rock Island, northeastern Scott and southeastern Clinton Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 401 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McCausland, or 12 miles west of Clinton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton, DeWitt, Camanche, Albany, McCausland, Low Moor, Malone, Rock Creek Marina and Campground, Folletts, Rock Creek Park, Clinton County Fairgrounds, and Princeton Wildlife Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
